newuser

Class NewUserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • newuser.NewUserController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataBaseHandler

    public class NewUserController
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataBaseHandler
    Contains the controller for the NewUser scene. This class creates a new row into the USERINFO table from the input provided by the user. Edited by Ryan McGurie 10/30/2018 - created database functionality. Edited by Ryan McGuire 11/14/2018 - added validation method to make sure user has correct format before placing information into database. Edited by Ryan McGuire 11/15/2018 - added alert box informing the user of a successful and unsuccessful input. Date 10/25/2018

    • Method Detail

      • createNewUserButtonPushed

        public void createNewUserButtonPushed()
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
        When this button is pushed, user input will be compared with valid format. If user info is in a valid format a new row will be created in the USERINFO table with information from the textfield and the scene will change to the LoginScene.fxml.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • cancelButtonPushed

        public void cancelButtonPushed()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        When this button is pushed, the scene will change to LoginScene.fxml.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.

      • checkDatabase

        public boolean checkDatabase(User user)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called it will check the USERINFO table to see if the username in the text field is all ready in use. If the user does not exist in the USERINFO table it will create a new row in the table with the input from pswd textfield, username textfield and email textfield.
        Specified by:
        checkDatabase in interface DataBaseHandler
        Parameters:
        user - user type with the data from the text fields.
        Returns:
        returns true if username from textfield is not in the USERINFO table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.

      • checkValidation

        public void checkValidation(boolean resultUserName,
                            boolean resultEmail,
                            boolean resultPassword,
                            java.lang.String password2,
                            DataBaseHandler checkDataBase,
                            User user)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.sql.SQLException
        When this method is called, it will check all text fields and compare it to valid input.
        Parameters:
        resultUserName - result of comparing the username text field with valid input.
        resultEmail - result of comparing the email text field with valid input.
        resultPassword - result of comparing the pswd text field with valid input.
        password2 - the re entered password created by the user in the pswd2 text field, Used to compare user type password.
        checkDataBase - method that performs database actions.
        user - the user type created from the text fields.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the IO exception.
        java.sql.SQLException - the SQL exception.
